text: the Bicycle Advisory Committee's top priority is a bike/ped bridge across I84 at 7th/8th/9th! <http://bikeportland.org/2015/02/27/portland-bicycle-advisory-committees-top-10-priorities-citywide-135111>

attachments.title: Here are the Portland Bicycle Advisory Committee's top 10 priorities citywide - BikePortland.org
attachments.text: How do you think they did?
attachments.fallback: BikePortland.org: Here are the Portland Bicycle Advisory Committee's top 10 priorities citywide - BikePortland.org

text: I feel like Barbur should be higher than #4
Scariest stretch to ride a bike (that I've experienced) in Portland.
that bridge
That's the main reason I didn't start bike commuting until I lived in the actual city
Sellwood bridge is my personal least favorite spot in the city. I rode Barbur once, but there was very low traffic at the time.

I could see Sellwood bridge being bad (not sure if I've ridden it before). Barbur is TERRIBLE during rush hour.... cars going 40-50 in the one lane and bikes being forced to cut out into moving traffic.
Maybe not 50... but fast
sellwood bridge was so scary. An unfortunate thing about Lewis & Clark was the two options to ride into town were either taking the Sellwood bridge or Barbur
ugh, no good
a friend of mine almost died in a hit and run on Barbur a couple years ago too
<http://www.oregonlive.com/portland/index.ssf/2013/11/lake_oswego_driver_sentenced_i.html>

attachments.title: Lake Oswego driver sentenced in SW Portland hit-and-run that injured Henry Schmidt
attachments.text: Miriam Clinton, 29, was sentenced to three years and four months in prison for the hit-and-run crash that critically injured Henry Schmidt.
attachments.fallback: OregonLive.com: Lake Oswego driver sentenced in SW Portland hit-and-run that injured Henry Schmidt

text: Yeah I swear, that route
I can tell you I sweat from my car just watching bikes ride that section.
shit, 40 months.
I'm surprised they sentenced her that much from stories I've heard. Is he ok now?
I wonder how much she would have gotten if she hadn't fled.
yeah he made a complete recovery which is awesome
This kind of thing makes me so nauseous with how many close calls I have in a week of nearly getting hit by moving vehicles.
IIRC she only got caught because the mechanic she took her car to after the accident saw the description of the pieces of the car left at the scene
Whoa!
that's way creepy
do mechanics look at descriptions like that as a matter of profession?
or was he just on the right subreddit at the right time?

Talks a little more about that here:

<http://www.oregonlive.com/portland/index.ssf/2013/11/driver_in_sw_portland_hit-and-.html>

attachments.title: Driver in SW Portland hit-and-run says she never knew she struck, hurt Henry Schmidt
attachments.text: Before being sentenced to three years and four months in prison, Miriam Clinton offers her account of what led to the Aug. 16 crash in one of her only public statements.
attachments.fallback: OregonLive.com: Driver in SW Portland hit-and-run says she never knew she struck, hurt Henry Schmidt

text: Well, glad to hear he's fully recovered!
yeah! there were a few campaigns when he was in the hospital, one to get him lots of yarn so he can knit and one to buy him lots of beer
hahaha
he got a ton of each
So perfect
